page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY of D. BLOCK.
page.content: This Domesday Block, deep in the heart of rural Shropshire,is divided into 3 distinct sections and separated by 2 escarpments running from south-west to north-east.The north section in Ape-dale,the central in Hope-dale,the southern in Corve-dale.The underlying rock is{ limestone}laid down in the Silurian period,400 million years ago. Today,the escarpments are heavily wooded,with a steep westerly face,and a gentle dip-slope to the east. The{valleys}vary in soil-type,the northern being the lightest,populated by a number of medium sized{mixed {farms.}The central Hope-dale has four farms working on lime-based clay soil,heavier in type. The southern section has a heavy,much wetter soil,covering parts of two large dairy farms.
